results.title: In our own backyards: uranium mining in the United States
results.creator_credit: Eleventh Hour Films, Sussanna Styron and Pamela Jones
results.brief_description: The mining and milling of uranium involves the stripping of vast areas of land, reduction of local water tables, release of radioactive gases into the air, and the creation of millions of tons of radioactive waste. This film explores the impact of this process on the environment, the health of the workers and nearby residents. Also explores social justice issues relating to exploitation of Navajo Indian workforce by the mining companies - to the detriment of the health of the native Americans so employed. Environmental health issues (affecting Navajo Indians living in the mines’ vicinity) are a further focus.

results.title: In other words
results.creator_credit: George Johnson, ONF | NFB and Jan Padgett
results.brief_description: In other words examines the effects of homophobia on gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender teens. Using interviews, animation, music, classroom discussion and dictionary definitions, this documentary aims to demystify homophobic language and to alert the viewer to its harmful effects. Although the documentary covers sophisticated territory, for example the difference between sexuality and gender identity, regular reference to the personal experiences of teenagers gives it clarity and relevancy. “In other words” is suitable for an audience aged 12-18.

results.title: In other lands: Bohemia
results.creator_credit: Post Pictures Corporation and Clyde E. Elliott
results.brief_description: The formation of the Czechoslovak Republic at the close of the World War brought together as the Czech, or Bohemian, nation the Slavs of Bohemia, Moravia and Slovakia. Czechoslovakia owes its sound financial and industrial position to men who ome of that enduring Slavic stock which for centuries has dominated Bohemia and Moravia. Shows Bohemians in traditional peasant dress and tells of the Bohemian farming peasants way of life - selling their produce at the market, attending church, celebrating a wedding, and particularly focuses on their various costume of dress. Photography by Horace C. Shimeld.

results.title: In open air: a portrait of the American impressionists
results.creator_credit: Paul Johnson, Smithsonian Institute and Roger Snodgrass
results.brief_description: A documentary about the late 19th century American Impressionists. The film reveals the nature of these artists’ sensibility and work; the specific French Impressionists from whom they drew inspiration; and the various artistic communities which they founded in America.

results.title: In one lifetime
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Political development in Papua New Guinea as seen through the eyes of Simon Kaumi, the Deputy Chief Electoral Officer. The progress he has seen in one lifetime includes the work of the Local Government Councils in replacing the traditional system and the 1968 House of Assembly election.

results.title: In one day
results.creator_credit: George Pearson, ONF | NFB and James Carney
results.brief_description: A cool, scientific look at weather forecasting, and the drama involved. From far-flung meteorological stations and observation posts, to the weather-plotting station of the Meteorological Station of Canada with its automated mapping machines, this examination of what weather is and how it is anticipated on a world scale makes absorbing viewing. Here, for a change, the weatherman is unquestionably the hero. Written by James Carney. Photography by Paul Leach and Gilles Gascon.Editing by William Brind. Music: Karl Duplessis. Sound by Bernard Bordeleau. (Awards: Columbus; Rome.)

results.title: In old Kentucky
results.brief_description: The American Civil War may divide a family when brothers Robert and George enlist on opposite sides but when one brother finds himself on the run after being captured as a spy, family loyalty comes to the rescue. Cast includes Henry B. Walthall, Owen Moore, Verner Clarges, Kate Bruce, Mary Pickford, Mack Sennett.

results.title: In My Room
results.brief_description: Being a teenager is hell. But in your private space, your bedroom, you can be yourself. In My Room enters the bedrooms of three teenagers: Kristy, a 17 year old who lives with her mum in a St. Kilda flat; Will, a 16 year old, boarding in a room with three other boys at Melbourne Grammar; and Jyka, a 14 year old Koorie who lives with his family in Broadmeadows. This film tells the story of their private places, filled with possessions that represent their past and future and the changing perspectives and passions affecting their lives.

results.title: In my room
results.creator_credit: Olympus Films, Film Victoria and Melissa Juhanson
results.brief_description: 3 teenagers speak candidly about their dreams, aspirations, fears and the sanctity that is their bedroom. 17 year old Kirsty lives in St Kilda with her mother, is deciding whether to pursue acting or music, and whether to return to school. Jyka is a 14 year old Koorie boy living in Broadmeadows with his extended family and aspires to move out when he’s 16, learn to read, and become a panel beater. 16 year old Will has moved from the country and is boarding at Melbourne Grammar. With remarkable candour and a palpable trust in the voiceless director, the three share their views on the world as perceived from their bedroom.
